brewery.brewery_description:
It started at the Horseshoe in Hampstead, North London, where Jasper Cuppaidge brewed beneath the pub.  We moved up out of the cellar and down the road into Camden Town where we converted seven old Victorian railway arches and installed a beautiful modern brewery, made by Braukon in Germany. We developed our ideas into recipes and sold our first beers into London in the summer of 2010. When ordering beers for the Horseshoe we had to get the lager and wheat beer from Germany and the pale ales from America. Why wasn’t anyone making them in London? Why couldn’t we get great examples of those beers made around the corner from us? So we decided to be the one to do it; to make the beers we really wanted to drink and to do it in Camden Town. The brewery was going to be called Mac’s, after Jasper’s grandfather, but a brewery in New Zealand had already trademarked it. Jasper started typing in web addresses. Having lived in Camden for years, that was where he started and camdentownbrewery.com was free… We had a name!  From 1910-60, Laurie McLaughlin, Jasper’s grandfather, ran McLaughlin’s Brewery (Mac’s) in Rockhampton, Australia. When he died, his daughter, Patricia, inherited the brewery and pub estate.
Patricia was young when this happened and she passed on the management, and then later the ownership of McLaughlin’s, to Carlton & United. A few years later, for Patricia’s 50th, Jasper recreated Mac’s beer for his mum in the cellar of the Horseshoe and that’s when it all started.

beer.beer_description: Less bitterness and roast malts than INK. It’s a smooth, dark, chocolatey stout.

WE LOVE OUR AMERICAN COUSINS.
But sometimes they can be kind of full on. So we’ve crafted this beer to more British tastes. Made with American hops, it’s still got all the punch of a pale ale. Just less shouty.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 50 distinct venues!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 55 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 12!

items.checkin_comment: Zing! Interesting take on a lager

beer.beer_description:
Introducing Zing Lager

Zing! and the thirst is gone. Are you tired of lagers all tasting the same? Fancy a fresh piney scent around your home? Need a bit more zing and pep in your life? Then this beer is the one for you. And now for the taste test. 

Hoppy + Crisp + Piney

ABV : 5.6%
HOPS: Centennial, Sultana, Chinook
MALT:  Pilsner, Carapils
YEAST: Lager

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 140 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 29!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 40 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 9.

beer.beer_description:
WHAT THE HELLS? THANKS FOR ASKING.
Hells is the lovechild of our two favourite German beer styles - Helles and Pilsner. Clean, crisp and dry, it’s the beer we always wanted to drink and the reason we started our brewery. We hope you agree.

Clean and refreshing with a dry hop finish. taste the great depth of flavour that comes from the long, slow maturation in tank. This is how a great lager should taste.

This is the beer Camden Town was born to brew. Combining two of our favourite beer styles into one, we take the crisp, dry body of a German-style Pilsner and give it the gentle hopping of a Helles to create the beer we really want to drink – this beer is the reason we decided to start a brewery.

items.checkin_comment:
Vom Fass in Jamie Oliver’s "Fifteen", London. Dunkle goldene Farbe, wenig Schaum. Fruchtiger Hopfenduft. Grapefruit und Kräuter. Schön frisch. Geschmack auch Citrus und medium bitter. Recht schnell weg.
Aroma (7)
Aussehen (3)
Flavor (6)
Mundgefühl (3)

When you want a punch of hops with a lighter finish, reach for a Cold IPA or India Pale Lager. That's 5 different beers with the style of IPA - Cold or Lager - IPL (India Pale Lager). Try 5 more or Level 2!

beer.beer_description:
WE LOVE OUR AMERICAN COUSINS.
But sometimes they can be kind of full on. So we’ve crafted this beer to more British tastes. Made with American hops, it’s still got all the punch of a pale ale. Just less shouty.

WHAT THE HELLS? THANKS FOR ASKING.
Hells is the lovechild of our two favourite German beer styles - Helles and Pilsner. Clean, crisp and dry, it’s the beer we always wanted to drink and the reason we started our brewery. We hope you agree.

Clean and refreshing with a dry hop finish. taste the great depth of flavour that comes from the long, slow maturation in tank. This is how a great lager should taste.

This is the beer Camden Town was born to brew. Combining two of our favourite beer styles into one, we take the crisp, dry body of a German-style Pilsner and give it the gentle hopping of a Helles to create the beer we really want to drink – this beer is the reason we decided to start a brewery.

Our ideal IPA wasn’t on the menu, so we made it. Resisting piling up a variety of hops like toppings on a burger, we held the pickles and did things our way. Sandwiching together light malts, clean Cali ale yeast and early harvest Simcoe hops. Just what the brewers ordered.

Lager’s typecast as refreshing, but capable of so much more. We’re proud to show off all the things our favourite beer style can be. Crisp and clean, of course, but also hoppy and juicy, like this little number. Ta-da!!

WHO GIVES A WIT?
We do and it’s not rude. Based on a traditional Belgian wit (white) beer, we’ve added the bergamot and lemon zest of Earl Grey tea for a well turned out beer that politely packs a punch.

A GOOD HEAD IS ESSENTIAL.
Especially when it comes to stout. We use nitrogen bubbles to give our Ink Stout its thick, creamy head and smooth finish. And without getting all big headed, we think it’s the finest stout in the land.
Loaded with roast and bitter dark chocolate, dark fruits, a rich and smooth body with linger dry finish.

Stout was born in london in the 18th century, but while the black stuff was made famous in ireland, it declined in popularity in the capital, until now. This changes everything and stout has never tasted so good.
Less bitterness and roast malts than INK. It’s a smooth, dark, chocolatey stout.

Long haul flights, luggage stamps and lounge music

Bermuda shorts and Hawaiian shirts, sunglasses and sun cream, Trinidad, St Tropez, and tan lines. Going on your hols is a break from the usual, and a chance to have fun. With this in mind, we created Camden Hols Lager. Happy holidays!

You know when you don’t speak to someone for a while and it gets kind of weird? That’s IPA and us. We hadn’t brewed one in ages, so called up IPA masters Wicked Weed. Together, we got to know a new IPA, light in body, with fruity hops and balanced bitterness, and here it is.

THIS IS THE BEER OF SUMMER.
This beer is fresh, piney and hoppy. By piney, we don’t mean you’re lost deep in the woods. More like you’re downwind of a pine forest and happen to get a nice whiff. Perfect for sunny days, whether in a beer garden or down your local wooded area.

This Bock is (mostly) brewed in true Bavarian style. Cold fermented slowly to bring out the balance between light hops and dark malt, but we did add experimental hop HBC472 for bonus bourbon and vanilla oakiness akin to barrel aging, which old-school Bavarian brewers might frown on, but we think tastes pretty good.
A New England Style IPA. Tropical and juicy notes of citrus watermelon and peach.

We’re living for the weeknights, so we made this beer. Unfiltered, dry-hopped and full of flavour, it’s lower in ABV, so more like dancing in the kitchen than an all-night rave (though what you do on a Tuesday is up to you).

We have a confession. Strawberry Hells isn’t really forever. Because we brew this beer with June-ripening, British strawberries, we can only make it in the summer. So while it’s tart, crisp and well rounded, it’s not around for long. We could have called it ‘Strawberry Hells sometimes’ but it didn’t have the same ring to it.

LIVE AND UNPLUGGED IN CAMDEN.
If Hells is our studio album, all slick finish and crisp sounds, then Unfiltered Hells is our live album. We leave the yeast in for a full bodied beer that’s just that little bit louder, bigger and real, man.

Good things come in small packages, like this beer. Inspired by ‘no coast’ IPA styles, juicy Sabro and Enigma hops paired with clean pilsner malt make it lighter than the usual IPA, with all the big flavours. Just like a canapé, and just as fun at a party.
Byron Pale Ale is a Pale Ale hopped with Cascade, Centennial, Galaxy and Motueka which is designed to be the perfect beer for a hamburger. It’s available in bottle at all Byron restaurants.

NO VANILLA JUDGEMENTS HERE

Classic styles are hardest to get right, just like lager. Introducing our freshest scoop yet, brewed with lactose and vanilla essence for an ice-cream inspired beer that’s more refreshing than a soft serve on a summer’s day. No chocolate flake needed.

When life gives us peaches, we make Bellinis. Brewed like the fizz, we added juicy peach puree, wine-like Nelson Sauvin hops and dry-hopped with fruity new HBC 431 hops. Because why should fizzy wine have all the fun. Bottoms up!

Fancy a cold one? Who doesn’t? But the ‘COLD’ in this IPA isn’t serving temperature (5-7c if you’re asking) it’s a new hybrid style brewed with lager yeast but at a warmer temperature, flaked rice for crispy-boi refreshingness, wheat for haze and mouthfeel and new world hops for big, fruity flavour.

As if it’s poured fresh from the tank at the brewery. Just like traditional German Kellerbiers, this lager is unfiltered. Brewed with torrified wheat, Callista hops and dry hopped with Spalt Select, it’s left hazy, hoppy, full bodied and fuss free.

Blossom, bank holidays, and trainers with no socks, the first outdoor ice cream – or beer – of the year – everyone has their springtime signifier. For us, spring hasn’t properly sprung until we’ve had our first pint of hoppy, juicy, fresh Inner City Green. Sock-wearing optional.

Head to the park, Inner City Green is now in cans!

This is our first seasonal beer to come off the canning line, perfect for festivals, picnics, garden parties, and any excuse to get outside in the sunshine.

The word green can mean immature, but not in Inner City Green’s case. Like all out lagers, it gets a full 4 weeks of maturation in tank to make sure it’s crisp, clean, green and all grown-up.

And good for beer too. This beer isn’t green, but it is full of green stuff – hops – with Nelson Sauvin, Galaxy and Amarillo all giving buckets of green grape, gooseberry and passion fruit aroma.

Longer, lighter days, call for lighter, brighter beers, so when the sun comes out, Inner City Green is your friend. Head to the nearest green patch to get maximum beer-in-the-sun exposure.

Drink Fresh. Think fresh. Suitable for Vegetarians and Vegans. Malt - Pilsner, Flaked Oats, Wheat, Carapils, Yeast - Bavarian, Lager Hops - Perle, Citra, Sabro, Idaho 7 Cryo. British weather is always a hot topic - Minus the heat. So, we've brought the tropic to Camden. We've packed our hazy lager with citrus and grapefruit to forecast tropical taste and combined it with oats for a smooth mouthfeel. Tropic. Like it's hot.

Harvest is hard work for farmers and a busy time of year for the rest of us. Rush through and it’ll be winter already, so enjoy this plentiful season by sharing some of said plenty and – if you aren’t operating agricultural machinery – a beer. We suggest this rich, robust version of Hells, made in appreciation of autumntime.
